result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Keisha A Roper

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for Keisha A Roper
Current: 2052 S. 85th St., Milwaukee, WI 53227 United States  (Effective: 10-19-2022)
Prior: 4622 South 20th Street # 3, Milwaukee, WI 53221

Defendant Keisha A Roper appeared by video.  Attorney Corey R. Flynn appeared by video for Keisha A Roper.  Prosecuting attorney Sarah Dahdouh appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Status conference held. Defense needs to complete a TAD evaluation. Case is adjourned in Branch 30.
Status conference scheduled for November 18, 2022 at 10:30 am.

Defendant Keisha A Roper appeared by video.  Prosecuting attorney Foley J. Van Lieshout in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for a pre-trial conference. Defendant is eligible for a public defender, but no counsel has been appointed. Case adjourned. 

**UPDATE OFF THE RECORD**
Attorney Corey Flynn has been assigned to the case. Defense has been notified of the next court date.
Status conference scheduled for September 23, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Pre-trial conference on September 9, 2022 at 08:30 am.
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Keisha A Roper in court.    Madeline Witte, under the student practice rule, appeared with A.D.A. Thomas L. Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant advised that this case is assigned to Judge Richards, Branch 30.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Defendant IS Public Defender eligible. Defendant is ordered to provide the public defender's office with the next court date.  
The case is adjourned to Br. 30 for a Pretrial Conference.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 9, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 08/15/2022@ 1:30p
